We are xSecIRC.

We are a secular international, non profit, volunteer driven, donation based, and gender-neutral community of cybersecurity enthusiasts. We are here to provide free education to people interested in cybersecurity and programming, and our motives are clear, we are here to obsolete entities making education a business.

The xSecIRC Manifesto

Cybersecurity has a gatekeeper problem. A handful of entities have made this field a goddamn business, built to keep you out unless you pay.

They sell you a fantasy of a six-figure job and a 'hacker' certification. The harsh reality? Their courses are often outdated, a quick search away, and built on hype. They take your money without giving you the skills needed to survive in the real world.

We don't just believe in change—we act.

xSecIRC is a force built to tear down those walls. We are a secular, non-profit army of volunteers united by one truth: education is a fundamental human right, not a commodity.

While they sell access, we provide it. Our mission is to obsolete the greedy and rig the system in favor of the people. We don't ask for a seat at their table—we're building our own.

This is not just a community; it's a revolution. If you're ready for a real fight, this is your home.

Our Core Principles

Secular & International

We are a global community, open to everyone, regardless of their background or beliefs.

Non-Profit & Volunteer Driven

We are not here to make money. We are here to make a difference. We are powered by volunteers who believe in our cause.

Donation Based

We rely on donations from the community to keep our servers running and our services free.

Gender-Neutral

We are a safe and inclusive space for everyone. We do not tolerate any form of discrimination.
